text:
Neosho County (standard abbreviation: NO) is a county in the south east of the U.S. state of Kansas. In 2010, 16,512 people lived there. The county seat is Erie.
19th century.
In 1861, Neosho County was created.
The first railroad was built through Neosho County in 1870.
Geography.
The U.S. Census Bureau says that the county has a total area of. Of that, is land and (1.1%) is water.
Presidential elections.
Neosho County is a very Republican county. However, like the rest of Southeast Kansas counties, Democrats have not done poorly.
